page.title: 01A VIEW OF GRAFFHAM
page.content:
Graffham is a small dormitory village south of Petworth and Midhurst. It is tucked into the northern side of the South Downs. It is very picturesque and has two pubs. The countryside is gently rolling chalk, mainly covered by woodlands or grazing with an array of wild flowers. Riding is popular with Ambersham polo ground nearby. Stud farms for polo ponies are a feature.
There are many clubs and societies. The church is at the top of the village with the attractive flint and timber primary school opposite. Although the road ends here there are many public footpaths over the Downs to the South Downs Way.
